name: Radisson Blu Strand Hotel, Stockholm

reviews.title: Get the newly renovated "business class rooms"
reviews.text: Initially had a superior guest room booked (more or less the standard accommodation), and was not impressed. Old furnishing, an antient CRT television and with very limited living space.

reviews.title: Miserable room overlooking restaurant in central courtyard
reviews.text: After asking for an upgrade (which the offered for 500 SEK) we were presented with a completely different level of room - the superb business class room with a beautiful view of Mälarsjön and a proper living area. On top of that, all premium channels are included and all the furnishing/technology is up-to-date.
Wouldn't stay here again without booking the latter room type, and since they offer it for merely a 15-20% premium one shouldn't ponder much about the two different options.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Stockholm

reviews.text: Positives: Good location, decent breakfast buffet
reviews.title: Fantastic Staff at the Radisson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives: Quite slow dinner service
reviews.title: unique sauna

reviews.text: The Radisson SAS Strand Hotel looked from my web research to be in a good central location and, most importantly, on the water. It was all of that. We liked it. We’d book there again. It was close to the Old Town, the New Town—what they call City, and to the museums. It looked out on boats and beautiful old buildings across the harbor.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We had a nice room with yellow painted wood furniture and blue furnishings that was appropriately Swedish and “old Scandinavian” but with a nicely appointed modern bathroom. The breakfast was ample with lots of variety and in a nicely lit restaurant space (though we never chose to have a meal other than breakfast there.) It has s a pleasant, large modern public space alongside the restaurant and the concierge desk with lots of group seating and a heavy duty cocktail scene from about 5 to 8 or so that was kind of fun to join in.
reviews.title: Central, noisy, expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prices vary by day with weekends being less expensive, so it is definitely a business hotel. We paid 3595 Swedish Kroner for our one weekday and 2395 for each of our weekend days, evening out to be about $400 per day US. Breakfast was extra and 180 SK per person or $36 US. As is often mentioned, Scandinavia is expensive.
reviews.title: Comfortable business hotel with wonderful location to see the sights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is nice, clean and with a superb location. However this is a noisy part of the city in the weends, so bring earplugs if you need to sleep.
reviews.title: For A Special Occasion

reviews.text: We stayed for a long weekend city break, our first time in Stockholm.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Great location, tiny room
reviews.text: Have stayed in Radisson hotels a number of times and felt this would be a good choice and to be fair it has some very strong points, the primary one being location, great to walk to most places as it is located right in the centre of town. Close to all the bars, clubs, shops etc...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very friendly, though this might be a Swedish trait rather then a hotel trait.
reviews.title: Interesting hotel, well located at a fair price for a 5 star

likes.liked: — The view. Air conditioning. Wireless Net.
likes.disliked: — Stairs inside the room. Sheets. Room too Small.

reviews.text: My only gripe would be the size of the rooms, they were tiny, I was sharing with a friend and hence had a twin room, the room was so small there was barely enough space to have a gap between the beds. The bathroom has also been rationalised to the point that it felt more like a cupboard, with the only standing room being the small gap between the toilet and the sink.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing inherently wrong with the hotel, but was very suprised about the size of the rooms.
reviews.title: Very well placed business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel seemed a bit old fashioned with an odd entrance.
reviews.title: great hotel in the trendy centre of stockholm!
Magic lights
reviews.text: We wanted to see the harbour so we booked a more expensve harbour view room and it was worth it when we woke up to see the Christmas lights all over the steam excursion boats right outside our window. Big room, great location and super helpful front desk though we were dissappointed they had booked their restaurant out to Christmas parties and guests could get only room service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a harbour view room a few weeks in advance and lucked out with getting what we found was one of the best rooms in the entire hotel. Room 601 is a one-bedroom sweet with a balcony and spectacular view. Great breakfast and staff made for one incredible stay.
reviews.title: Best Spot in Stockholm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Strand is one of the best hotels I've stayed at anywhere. Just make sure you get a "premium" room overlooking the water. The standard "inside" rooms aren't worth the money. The summer and weekend discounts are substantial, making this hotel excellent value if you get the right room! Can't recommend it enough!
reviews.title: Outstanding!
very comfortbable
reviews.text: It was not easy to choose a hotel for our city trip to Stockholm. I had on my shortlist: the Grand (too 'grand', too forbiddingly expensive); the Rival (too ' hip', plus very small rooms); the clarion (too much of a tourbus hotel, plus unattractive location). I chose the Radisson Strand and we were pleased with our choice. While the hotel does not exude luxury and style, it is very very comfortable. The location is perfect, with everything walking distance. We had a business class room, which had a nice size and as added extras breakfast included (an excellent buffet), free internet (important for us) and bathrobes and slippers. The beds were good (though I didn't like the foam pillows) and the bathroom was stylish (except the ill fitting cheap plastic toilet seat). The staff was pleasant and efficient. All in all we didn't miss one single amenity or service during our stay, so I can recommand the hotel.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: The hotel is close to all major attractions, in a charming area of the city. I had a very comfortable business-type room with nice sea view. The only downside was the noisy ventilation system which could not be shut down at night.

aka: Radisson Blu Strand Hotel, Stockholm Hotel Stockholm
description: Traditional 7-story hotel in pleasant city-center location overlooking waterfront.
